column1: Online TransactionPay Online   Link to External Website
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Table Tennis clubs within the Borough
The Tame Valley Initiative encompasses a wide range of projects aimed at improving both the physical and social infrastructure of the Valley and its immediate surroundings
• Tameside Advisory and Monitoring Service
The service provides support and challenge to schools in raising the achievement of their pupils. For further information telephone 0161 342 3249
• Tameside Business Environment Association

Links to the home site of TBEA which is a nonprofit partnership organisation aimed at helping Tameside companies take full advantage of the benefits associated with improved control of the environmental aspects of their activities
• Tameside Business Security Guide
• Tameside Children's Fund

Tameside Children's Fund is a web site aimed at 5 - 13 year olds who live in the area. The Fund's main focus is to involve children and young people in planning and delivering services that will provide for themselves and other children in the community.
• Tameside Children's Information Service
A guide to childcare within Tameside
The Tameside Citizen newspaper is distributed free to all Tameside households 4 times a year.
• Tameside College
Links to the home site of Tameside College
• Tameside Community Alarm Service
Help on hand 24 hours a day at the touch of a button. The service is linked to the council's new call centre and mobile warden service. Available to anyone living in Tameside
• Tameside General Hospital
Tameside General Hospital, Fountain Street, Ashton-under-Lyne, OL6 9RW, telephone 0161 331 6000
A borough wide scheme to enhance your environment
• Tameside Leisure Park
full list of services available at the centre which is now under the management of Tameside Sports Trust
• Tameside Local Safeguarding Children Board
A designated multi-agency group sharing information and practice to help protect childrenk
Providing instrumental tuition and music ensembles for pupils. The unit is based at Festival Hall, Denton, telephone 0161 320 4246 for further details
• Tameside Road Safety Unit
• Tameside Sports Trust
Tameside Council have transferred management of the provision of sports and leisure facilities to a newly created charitable trust
• Tameside Strategic Partnership
Tameside's Strategic Partnership Board brings together major employers, key public organisations and the Voluntary and Community Sectors to improve the well-being of Tameside's residents
the Government's programme to deliver the best start in life for every child by bringing together: early education, childcare, health and family support
• Tameside Ted

Tameside Ted is a friendly bear loved by children and is used to publicise events, carnivals, fairs etc and is the Division's mascot. He helps to promote health and safety amongst the residents of the Borough
• Tameside TV

Initially focused on the use of ICT in Schools, this project aimed to produce and broadcast training and information footage to schools and individuals via video streaming. However, the power of the medium and the high quality of the work produced has led to interest from across the council.
For information and to register premises and operatives
• Tax Credits
Find out more on Tax Credits and use the online calculator from HM Revenues and Customs
Information on taxing and registering a vehicle
Hackney carriage and private hire vehicles, drivers and owners are licensed by the council.
Need advice or guidance about a young person aged 0-17?
Information and Communication Technology - The Council has an ICT Strategy to maximise the well-being of the people of Tameside
• Television Licensing
Links to the TV Licensing website which offers a range of ways to purchase your TV licence, including an on-line facility for credit card payments
• Temporary Traffic Lights
On-line notification/application form for accredited contractors for temporary portable traffic control signals
To view the list of contracts currently up for renewal
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Tennis clubs within the Borough
• Theft of Paving Stones
Use the on-line form to report offenders of paving stone theft
• Tips (Household Waste Recycle Centres)
For locations and opening hours of local sites
• Titles, Honours and Medals
Information from DirectGov on the UK system of honours and medals and on how to nominate someone for an honour
• Toilets
Find out where they are and use the on-line form to report a problem
• Tom Pendry University Scholarships
You may be eligible to apply for a Scholarship towards a University placement

For local and national information on what's on and where to visit, photocopying facilities, local gifts and souvenirs and details of Tameside's blue plaques. The Centre is also an agent for National Express coach travel, Maynes, Southport Flower Show and National Holidays
• Town Halls and Community Buildings
Lists the local town halls. Some rooms have bars for hire and a first class catering service is also available
Bringing higher levels of safety and security to the streets of Tameside
Information from Trading Standards on how to buy safe toys
• Trade Refuse
We provide a full range of waste collection and disposal services to businesses
The service includes consumer protection, weights and measures, trade descriptions, food labelling and composition, product safety, consumer credit
• Traffic Lights
To report defective traffic lights - in emergency situations telephone 0161 342 8355
For information on traffic calming measures and traffic management schemes.
• Train Pass for Pupils and Students
For the criteria, and application form for pupil/student free school bus/train pass or cycle allowance
• Training and Employment Initiatives
Find out more about training in your local community and the venues in which these courses are held
• Trains
Links to GMPTE's web site detailing timetables for local buses, trains and trams
The council can provide an interpreter translation service in the main Asian languages spoken in the borough (Bengali, Gujarati, Punjabi and Urdu)
• Transport
To view the joint plan submitted on behalf of the ten Greater Manchester District Councils and the Greater Manchester Passenger Transport Authority
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Transport clubs within the Borough.
Information on various aspects of travelling, whether in Britain or Worldwide
• Travel Passes
Details of free travel passes available in Tameside
• Travel to School
For the criteria, and application form for pupil/student free school bus/train pass or cycle allowance
• Traveller, Refugee and Asylum Seekers
Information regarding our Consolidation of Learning Team (COLT)
Frequently asked questions about trees including information about Tree Preservation Orders
Tameside has twinning links with towns in France, Germany, China and Zimbabwe
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
